before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"72e9e","text":"Optimal Quantities","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3fn1","text":"NEB recommends a total of 0.03–0.2 pmols of DNA fragments when 1 or 2 fragments are being assembled into a vector, and 0.2–0.5 pmols of DNA fragments when 4–6 fragments are being assembled. Efficiency of assembly decreases as the number or length of fragments increases. To calculate the number of pmols of each fragment for optimal assembly, based on fragment length and weight, we recommend the following formula, or using the tool, NEBiocalculator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":26,"length":14},{"style":"bold","offset":118,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":435,"length":15}],"data":{}},{"key":"cc90b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b51l3","text":"pmols = (weight in ng) x 1,000 / (base pairs x 650 daltons)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5iuu4","text":"50 ng of 5000 bp dsDNA is about 0.015 pmols","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bpsic","text":"50 ng of 500 bp dsDNA is about 0.15 pmols","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8m43s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3qc4k","text":"The mass of each fragment can be measured using the NanoDrop instrument, absorbance at 260 nm or estimated from agarose gel electrophoresis followed by ethidium bromide staining.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"FFE4F3F485AE11EAA34F0242AC110007","url":"https://www.neb.com/external-links/nebiocalculator"}}}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7j1d7","text":"NEBuilder HiFi DNA Assembly Master Mix was developed to improve the efficiency and accuracy of DNA assembly. This method allows for seamless assembly of multiple DNA fragments, regardless of fragment length or end compatibility. This method has been used to assemble either single-stranded oligonucleotides or different sizes of DNA fragments with varied overlaps (15–80 bp). It has utility for the synthetic biology community, as well as those interested in one-step cloning of multiple fragments due to its ease of use, flexibility and simple master-mix format. The reaction includes different enzymes that work together in the same buffer (see Figure 1 in Guidelines):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":114,"length":6},{"key":1,"offset":659,"length":10}],"data":{}},{"key":"3vcpo","text":"The exonuclease creates single-stranded 3´ overhangs that facilitate the annealing of fragments that share complementarity at one end (the overlap region)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85loh","text":"The polymerase fills in gaps within each annealed fragment","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bsm3e","text":"The DNA ligase seals nicks in the assembled DNA ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"775bn","text":"The end result is a double-stranded fully sealed DNA molecule that can serve as template for PCR, RCA or a variety of other molecular biology applications, including direct transformation ofE coli.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":190,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5qbf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"61nng","text":"NEBuilder HiFi DNA Assembly kits are available in various formats: with NEB 5-alpha chemically competent cells (Cloning Kit, NEB #E5520), as a bundle with NEB 10-beta chemically competent cells (Bundle for Large Fragments, NEB #E2623) and without competent cells (Master Mix, NEB #E2621) . NEB 5-alpha chemically competent cells are excellent for routine assemblies of 15 kb or less. NEB recommends NEB 10-beta Competent E. coli (High Efficiency, NEB #C3019) or NEB 10-beta Electrocompetent E. coli (NEB #C3020) for assemblies larger than 15 kb. If the assembled genes contain repetitive sequences, NEB Stable Competent E. coli (NEB #C3040) should be used. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":421,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":491,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":620,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":112,"length":23},{"key":3,"offset":195,"length":38},{"key":4,"offset":264,"length":22},{"key":5,"offset":430,"length":27},{"key":6,"offset":500,"length":10},{"key":7,"offset":629,"length":10}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"CF623F3A85AE11EAA34F0242AC110007","url":"https://www.neb.com/tools-and-resources/video-library?\u0026videoid={712DD7CC-20AF-48CB-8F20-B6BB8783156B}"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"F1AA4240A0EA11EA962A715E83989382","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/nebuilder-hifi-dna-assembly-reaction-e2621-bfhrjj56/guidelines"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"CF623F8985AE11EAA34F0242AC110007","url":"https://www.neb.com/products/e5520-nebuilder-hifi-dna-assembly-cloning-kit"}},"3":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"CF623FBA85AE11EAA34F0242AC110007","url":"https://www.neb.com/products/e2623-nebuilder-hifi-dna-assembly-bundle-for-large-fragments"}},"4":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"CF623FE585AE11EAA34F0242AC110007","url":"https://www.neb.com/products/e2621-nebuilder-hifi-dna-assembly-master-mix"}},"5":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"CF62400F85AE11EAA34F0242AC110007","url":"https://www.neb.com/products/c3019-neb-10-beta-competent-e-coli-high-efficiency"}},"6":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"CF62403A85AE11EAA34F0242AC110007","url":"https://www.neb.com/products/c3020-neb-10-beta-electrocompetent-e-coli"}},"7":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"CF62406085AE11EAA34F0242AC110007","url":"https://www.neb.com/products/c3040-neb-stable-competent-e-coli-high-efficiency#Product%20Information"}}}}

the In-Fusion HD Cloning Kit (Clontech Takara Bio USA, Inc), according to recommended protocols. 2 μl of assembly reaction was transformed into supplied competent cells. 1/50 of outgrowth was spread on an steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7a8r4","text":"Set up the following reaction   (to   total volume):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":30,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":36,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"94ab3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9g4dn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"92l40","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"2F5063B085AF11EAB39DC7550D40315A","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"","unit":165}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","guid":"365E8980A0ED11EA962A715E83989382","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}},"2":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_7":{"className":"_dt-italic"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center _dt-bold"},"C_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center _dt-bold"},"D_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center _dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["","","",""],"colWidths":[205,"191","191","191"],"data":[[" ","Recommended Amount of Fragments Used for Assembly","",""],["","2–3 Fragment Assembly*","4–6 Fragment Assembly**","Positive Control ✝"],["Recommended DNA Molar Ratio","vector:insert = 1:2","vector:insert = 1:1"," "],["Total Amount of Fragments","0.03–0.2 pmols* X μl","0.2–0.5 pmols** X μl","10 μl"],["NEBuilder HiFi DNA Assembly Master Mix","10 μl","10 μl","10 μl"],["Deionized H2O","10-X μl","10-X μl","0"],["Total Volume","20 μl ✝✝","20 μl ✝✝","20 μl"]],"guid":"825CFA70B72311E88916D1DB482D0BED","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b281k","text":"* Optimized cloning efficiency is 50–100 ng of vector with 2-fold excess of each insert. Use 5-fold molar excess of any insert(s) less than 200 bp. Total volume of unpurified PCR fragments in the assembly reaction should not exceed 20%. To achieve optimal assembly efficiency, design 15-20 bp overlap regions between each fragment.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"54ii5","text":"** To achieve optimal assembly efficiency, design 20-30 bp overlap regions between each fragment with equimolarity of all fragments (suggested: 0.05 pmol each).","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"65o1s","text":"† Control reagents are provided for 5 experiments.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ehuvj","text":"†† If greater numbers of fragments are assembled, increase the volume of the reaction, and use additional NEBuilder HiFi DNA Assembly Master Mix.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{"B_1":[3,1]},"printData":[[" ","Recommended Amount of Fragments Used for Assembly","",""],["","2–3 Fragment Assembly*","4–6 Fragment Assembly**","Positive Control ✝"],["Recommended DNA Molar Ratio","vector:insert = 1:2","vector:insert = 1:1"," "],["Total Amount of Fragments","0.03–0.2 pmols* X μl","0.2–0.5 pmols** X μl","10 μl"],["NEBuilder HiFi DNA Assembly Master Mix","10 μl","10 μl","10 μl"],["Deionized H2O","10-X μl","10-X μl","0"],["Total Volume","20 μl ✝✝","20 μl ✝✝","20 μl"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23],"show_headers":true}}}}
